**Summary**
• Honda is reviving the Prelude, a sporty coupe, after 25 years, aiming to offer an alternative to crossover SUVs.
• The new Prelude is a 200-horsepower hybrid equipped with technology that simulates gear changes.
• The vehicle is designed to evoke nostalgia while incorporating modern hybrid technology.
• In Japan, the Prelude starts at approximately $41,600 (6.18 million yen).
• The Prelude is a front-wheel-drive coupe.

**Why it matters**
• Users interested in sporty coupes now have a new option that combines hybrid technology with a nostalgic design.
• Investors and builders may see this as an indicator of Honda's strategy to blend classic models with modern technology, potentially influencing future product development.

**Risks**
• The success of the Prelude depends on consumer acceptance of its hybrid powertrain and simulated shifting experience.

**Opportunities**
• Honda can capitalize on the nostalgia factor and the growing demand for hybrid vehicles.

**Market view**
Market — The reintroduction of the Honda Prelude could signal a broader trend of automakers reviving classic models with modern technology.
